knimeNode.name: Angle-Dependent Pixel Features 2D
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node to calculate angle-dependent pixel features.

fullDescription.intro: Node to calculate angle-dependent pixel features. The pixel features are represented in a feature image with two additional dimensions: one for the features and the other for the orientations (angles). Hence each pixel (X,Y) has a specific value for a certain feature (F) and a certain angle/orientation (O). In conjunction with polygons (represented by a labeling) these features can be used to create a boundary model (with the according node).

tab.name: Features
tab.option: Gabor filters of the given radius are convolved with the source image for the specified number of orientations. Each combination of the parameters scales, frequencies and elongations (comma separated list of real numbers) is a new "point" in the feature dimenion (for the given number of orientations).

For the given number of orientations all the pixel values along a line through a pixel a considered as a individual feature. Hence, a radius of 10 leads to 2*10+1 features for the specified number of orientations.
